radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple rounded, hypoechoic areas in the spleen, which was not enlarged; no evidence of cholelithiasis or cholecystitis.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Numerous ill-defined, hypoattenuating lesions, 1 to 2 cm in diameter, in the spleen; bilateral, dependent atelectasis in the lungs; a hypoattenuating lesion in the liver, measuring less than 1 cm in diameter; small, nonspecific retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The hypoattenuating lesion in the liver was slightly increased in size from a study 8 years earlier.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Ill-defined opacity in the left apex, overlying the end of the first rib, and a rounded opacity in the left hilar region.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A follow-up chest radiograph obtained a year after the initial presentation showed resolution of the opacities in the left upper lobe and persistent mild hilar lymphadenopathy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy, bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy, enlarged anterior diaphragmatic lymph node (1.2 cm in diameter), clustered nodular opacities within the lung in a perilymphatic distribution, multiple splenic lesions, a hypervascular lesion in the posterior right lobe of the liver, and a hypodense lesion (0.6 cm) in the left lobe of the liver thought to represent a hepatic cyst.
